intro: Himantoglossum anthropophorum, commonly known as the human tongue orchid, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its vivid pink and white flowers that resemble a human tongue, a feature that gives it its common name. This plant is native to southern Europe and thrives in calcareous soils, often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. The flowers are typically 5–8 cm in length and bloom from June to August. It is a perennial herb that produces erect, leafy stems and is known for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
